intro: Uragoga ceratoloba, commonly known as the horned bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble small horns, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Uragoga ceratoloba is adapted to survive in harsh conditions with minimal water, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
